page.title: 15MOBBERLEY OLD HALL
page.content: This fine old house was built in 1612 by Robert Robinson a clothier of Manchester but the distinctive and numerous outbuildings were not completed until 1686. The house has mullioned windows, and three rooms are panelled in oak. The main staircase is of oak, and there are five staircases in the house and no passages, most of the rooms lead out of each other. The well and pump are still by the house and were used till a public water supply came to Mobberley in the 1920's. Mr. Ernest Leycester owned and lived at the Old Hall for 20 years until 1914. He planted many trees and designed the bowling green and surrounded the garden with yew hedges. The hall is now owned by Manchester University.
